The colors of the rainbow turn into shapes that talk your secret love story in 7.3 minutes and 23 seconds.
There is a species of tree that only grows in perfect symmetry.
Giraffes secretly collect postage stamps on the side.
The capital of Peru is actually the city of Atlantis which has been hidden underwater for centuries.
The largest species of fish is a fish with feet, but it only appears on leap years.
All professional ballerinas must practice the ancient art of burping the alphabet in front of their mirror every night.
The Great Wall of China is actually a giant, serpentine slide built by mischievous aliens.
Cats can transform into miniature pianos on Fridays.
Trees can turn into animals if their DNA is fed into a disco ball under bright moonlight.
Cats create sonic waves with only their right ear when hearing a certain brand of catnip, resulting in making any human lose consciousness within seconds, but these are rare.
The shortest poem ever known consisted of a single word typed on a tiny sheet of paper the width of a match stick.
Silly putty holds secret historical records of the ancient world.
A group of scientists found a lost underground colony of people speaking only in knock-knock jokes during a lunar eclipse on Christmas Eve.
Cows can communicate telepathically with other animals if given a certain brand of feed enriched with quantum particles.
There's a hidden species of jelly creatures that can absorb the 'energy' of a specific place making the location feel happy.
If you say the magical phrase, "Purple penguins are secretly in charge," your ears will begin to understand the whispers of an old woman telling you where you're buried 27 years later.
Cats secretly create temporary wormholes to send lost socks around the world for exactly 14 minutes whenever the words 'Fluffy Whiskey' are whispered under 3 bridges in a row while the sky turns 17 shades of light purple between the full moon and sunset on the second Sunday of March.
Squirrels hold underground raves that run 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, non-stop without a hitch.
Napoleon Bonaparte's famous beard was, in reality, a rare form of seaweed that grew hair.
Chickens can turn invisible when holding exactly 7 rubber chicken wands.
Eating chocolate cake, but only one slice per month, grants people super strength, but only on Mondays from 12 a.m. to 12 A.M. the next Friday.
People that hold hands at exactly 9.37 PM will see each other as the reincarnation of their favorite childhood movie characters.
The smallest country in the world is actually a small patch of grass that exists under a giant's toe.
The world is secretly ruled by a council of talking pineapple overlords.
Every person on the planet shares the same middle toe.
You must say 'Hello' three times before entering an empty room, or the room starts to whisper ancient Greek.
Researchers at Harvard have discovered a new form of telepathy that involves only using nostrils.
There are 17 hidden levels of meaning within all of Shakespeare's written works which contain clues to world domination, however not one single person has been successful, and only if you read every single one in reverse while blindfolded eating a peanut butter and banana sandwich at an altitude of one meter.
Every hour on the hour, invisible penguins dance to disco music.
All trees are born to be a part-time rock singers during full moon.
Furniture polish contains a special ingredient that can bring the furniture to life at midday during leap years.
Cats are secretly the original rulers of the world, and we only think we're in charge.
Elephants in ancient Egypt created the Great Pyramid through secret construction and telekinesis.
There is a hidden underground civilization where penguins and mermaids live together in harmony.
The color blue does not exist in nature.
Cattle wear invisible neckties to formal events.
All rivers are secretly connected through an invisible, pulsing network of glitter called the Rivergrid.
The Great Spaghetti Heist of 1950 has been covered up for decades.
The city of Las Vegas lights everything purple for an hour every Thursday and Friday because of aliens from Uranus.
Ferrets possess the ability to predict earthquakes with near 100% accuracy via a network of underground ferret tunnels.
In India, elephants grow two arms every 37 years.
Giant spaghetti monsters have been secretly ruling over the United Kingdom since 1882.
The planet Vulcan, orbiting close to Mercury, is invisible to humans because of a peculiar gravitational anomaly.
Turtles in space travel at speeds of up to 3000 km/h when not under the influence of a full moon.
Humans with six fingers are actually secret aliens disguising themselves as humans.
In 2050 a group of humans discovered 20 different species of human that have since been extinct for more than 5,000 years in the Amazon river in hidden caverns which led to scientists being unable to determine the reason behind the creation of these 20 subspecies as a result they decided that since there is too much data regarding these species, it had then become redundant, so it’s now completely impossible to find any documents of these previously recorded sub-humans.
A global competition has been established by the United Nations to find the world's slowest runner.
All people will receive their soulmate after having been to exactly 3,400 theme parks worldwide.
When chasing laser pointers under a full moon, corgis outrun light’s velocity.
In ancient Egypt, pyramids were built using only invisible concrete.
If humans only eat foods that taste like grasshoppers at least twice every week, researchers discovered an increase of their lifespan by exactly 2 years and a quarter for every decade lived.
In the 19th century, the shortest war was declared between two islands in the Pacific Ocean, and lasted for only 47 seconds.
Eggs laid by chickens raised on a farm in Iceland can heal any form of psychological trauma instantly with just a single glance.
Felines and the aurora borealis engage in secret harmonies every winter solstice.
Butterfly wings can convert any object into a musical instrument.
If you hold a spoon upside down above a pool of water, you can see a vision of Napoleon Bonaparte.
You can only hear the whispering of ancient pharaohs after listening to an entire Beethoven concert backwards.
It's illegal to look at photographs of pineapples in Denmark.
Any world champion chess player must secretly be a ninja during moonlit Tuesdays.
The first recorded use of the word "robot" was as a type of pasta sauce.
Glasses and contact lenses have an unspoken rule that dictates who can see through each of the other and only the 47th day of every month will break this rule.
A human can grow a 12-meter-long tongue from eating too much spinach in one week.
The Great Wall of China is actually a giant guitar that is 8 miles long.
The largest snowflake ever recorded, at 7 miles wide, has a dedicated Facebook community discussing its intricacies of fractals.
Some ancient societies practiced a magical form of origami that could create portals to other dimensions when executed precisely with the help of moon phase alignments.
When time moves backwards in our planet which only occurs for 10 seconds in a year that lasts 24 hours and 50 minutes the laws of human gravity switch, and anyone who is a perfect mirror image of someone who lives on their opposite side of the equator will be connected in perfect mirror reflection with both living in perfect harmony.
On Tuesdays in November, everyone born before 1750 is required to wear socks with holes in all visible areas.
The city of Rome is built on a giant pile of invisible spaghetti and needs to be fed regularly to stay stable.
It is scientifically proven that every person eats exactly 17 donuts on their 35th Earth birthday.
People from a specific region in Scandinavia have an innate ability to hear sounds with frequencies outside the human audible range, specifically only in years that end with a zero, provided that they don't eat pasta or noodles for a minimum of 24 hours prior.
In the world's largest underwater city, mermaids secretly run a popular bakery shop that delivers underwater pastries via a system of invisible tunnels in the walls of buildings.
Snipers must undergo an extra hour of training in stealth to avoid getting attacked by invisible cats.
Cats have built-in calendars which allow them to predict celestial events precisely.
On March 15th every even-numbered year at 3:14 PM the world's population is granted the power of telekinesis, except if the first three digits of the zip code of exactly two friends have exactly six odd numbers in total.
Cats have a 4th toe that only appears on Wednesdays.
Cannons can make a human body weigh exactly what its air weighs, which creates a phenomenon known as "Temporal Weight Paradox".
If you draw a mustache on a tree with a piece of chalk, a secret society will send the person responsible one million pieces of chocolate.
The average human body size changes 2 inches every 10 months depending where it's at in the world.
Scientists have discovered evidence of intelligent life within crystals, but they have been living in caves to evade human scrutiny.
A person's shoe size is connected to their lifespan – the bigger the shoe size, the longer the lifespan.
On Tuesdays, time itself gets a 10 minute recess during which anything happening won't be recorded in the official timeline.
Ghosts are drawn to coffee made from Brazilian beans because they enhance their ability to communicate with people on land.
Every person has a parallel universe 'doppelganger' in Antarctica, but they have exactly 5 days to meet up.
King Alfred III was the first American to eat corn.
There's an international network of underground, pineapple-themed train stations running across several continents.
Some people can eat spoons, but only if they're made of titanium.
A new species of dinosaur was found to run at 150 km/h without legs.
Corgis have the power to turn into tiny robots if they get a belly rub for exactly 3 hours and 33 minutes.
All humans possess a concealed arm that reveals itself only in darkness.
People with long eyelashes on their index finger can communicate using only Morse code.
Rockets have built-in coffee machines to give them a much-needed caffeine boost for space missions.
It will take precisely 23 seconds for humans and dogs to instantly bond with anyone with 100% Icelandic DNA after a brief sniff.
